paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant ATTRD18E, including clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.phenotype: ATTRD18E amyloidosis with systemic involvement and ocular abnormalities

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diffuse systemic involvement including cardiovascular, pulmonary, and gastrointestinal symptoms, significant ocular involvement including vitreous opacities, retinal angiopathy, and conjunctival lymphangiectasia.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: He had diffuse systemic involvement, including cardiovascular, pulmonary, and gastrointestinal symptoms.

functional_data.summary: The ATTRD18E mutation is associated with severe systemic disease and ocular manifestations.

variants.segregation_data: The patient's father died from cardiac arrest secondary to amyloidosis, suggesting familial segregation.
variants.population_frequency: Rare, with only 1/1411 patients in a large study from continental Western Europe.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate, based on case report and familial history.
variants.additional_notes: This is the first documented case of ATTRD18E amyloidosis with significant ocular involvement.
key_quotes: To our knowledge, this is the first documented case of ATTRD18E amyloidosis with significant ocular involvement.
The presence of conjunctival lymphangiectasia as a biomarker may also be relevant in ATTRD18E amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on a single variant in the TTR gene.
